subsc: Other industry,Flood protection,Roads and highways,Telecommunications,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project rating is
            satisfactory, sustainability is likely, and the
            institutional development impact is substantial. Lessons
            drawn from the project spell out that, prior to any
            technical assistance agreement, the implementing
            agency's capacity should be confirmed, to be able to
            provide for required training, if any. Free standing
            technical assistance components (not those supporting
            project preparation), should focus on the agreed overall
            objectives, within the context of the Country Assistance
            Strategy. Furthermore, the soundness of proposed technical
            assistance components, should be assessed prior to project
            inclusion, thus ensuring quality at entry, and, project
            design should incorporate flexibility, allowing for the
            necessary adjustments in technical assistance components, or
            for modifications by executing agencies, on its contents,
            without altering objectives. Project coordination,
            particularly with subprojects under different task managers,
            should be firmly agreed prior to project, and subprojects approval.
